indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have an Air Quality department (1) under the  national center for Meteorology which is responsible on air quality and gaz emission across the kingdom. A dashboard is available with data from 84 air quality monitoring stations (2). Data available per station include : CO, No2, O3, So2, PM10, and PM2.5. 
 
## References

1- https://ncm.gov.sa/Ar/Environment/AirQuality/Pages/AirQuality.aspx
2- https://ncm.gov.sa/Ar/Environment/AirQuality/Pages/AQ-Dashboard.aspx

indicators.justification:
The research did not find any evidence of information on endangered species and ecosystems published in Saudi Arabia.

The National Center for Wildlife have an open data section in its website with reports, agreements, regulations, and some statistics data related to : expenses, training, licenses, violations, events only (1).

indicators.justification:
Ministry of commerce have an online service that can provide companies information based on CR number, however this service require registration (1).

Chamber of commerce provides also a Business directory of companies registered, however this service does not provide any ownership information (2).

Company information is also available on request as a paid service by the Ministry of commerce (3).

indicators.justification:
Ministry of commerce publishes company register as open data on the national open data portal in a yearly basis (1). Datasets includes among others : Issued commercial register, agencies, and trademarks.

Jeddah Chamber of commerce and industry provides has a business directory of companies and businesses registered in Jeddah (2).

There is a private business directory that claim to have data for the largest big cities in the Kingdom : Riyadh, Makkah and Jeddah (3). But their website show only basic business information such as name and contact phone numbers and email.

## References

1- https://mci.gov.sa/en/OpenData/Pages/default.aspx
2- https://www.jcci.org.sa/English/Pages/Business-Directory.aspx
3- http://bluepages.com.sa/

indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) information available as open data in their national open data portal (1)(2). These datasets are published by multiple organizations including the ministry of health, ministry of interior and Statistics Authority.

## References

1- https://data.gov.sa/Data/en/dataset?q=birth
2- https://data.gov.sa/Data/en/dataset?q=death

Birth information includes data about place of registration and month of registration.
Birth information includes data about age, educational attainment, and ethnic and/or national group of mother.
Birth information includes data about age of father and place of usual residence.
Birth information includes data about site of delivery, attendant at birth, and month in which prenatal care began.

The research did not find any information about the real-time capacity of the healthcare system in Saudi Arabia.

indicators.justification:
Since the beginning of the pandemic April 2020 (1), Saudi Ministry of Health provided a dashboard with real time information about the covid19 situation in the country (2).

The Dashboard provides daily and cumulative report, with new and recovered cases, PCR Tests, deaths, vaccines...etc. An open data section is available under the cumulative tab and provides all the data displayed in the dashboard as open data in Json format (3) (4).

indicators.justification:
The General Authority for Survey and Geospatial Information is the Government entity responsible for land use information in Saudi Arabia (1). The map is available at the authority website as image, or PDF only.

There is a map for Riyadh city with different layers released by the Municipality of Riyadh (2).

indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have a recent legal framework for ownership of new real estate units (1)(2) since November 9th, 2020. 

Land ownership information is available at the ministry of Justice, and there is a new portal Najiz (3) to request  land ownership information. However this data is not available for public.

indicators.justification:
The Saudi Ministry of Finance publish quarterly the state budget performance report, and data is available updated since 2017 until Q2 2021 (1).

Some datasets are published on the national open data portal including budget and spend of some ministries (2), some spend data, but does not include government budget and spending information.

## References

1- https://www.mof.gov.sa/en/financialreport/2021/Pages/default.aspx
2- https://data.gov.sa/Data/ar/dataset?_organization_limit=0&tags=%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%B2%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A9

There is structured data about the government's extrabudgetary funds spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.

There is structured data about public corporations' spending, in gross terms and on an accrual basis.

Budget entries have economic classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have functional classifications to an internationally agreed standard.
Budget entries have program classifications according to an internationally agreed standard.
Information about individual financial transactions or expenditures is available at the most disaggregated level of the economic classification level.
Data is disaggregated by cross-cutting programs, or issues such as SDGs, climate action, gender budgeting, etc,
The data contains common identifiers to connect budget and budget performance data.
The data contains identifiers that can be used to connect budget data with data on major projects (e.g., infrastructure construction) and procurement processes.

There are accessible and open official tools available to help users explore data.
Data is timely and updated.
Historical data is available that allows users to track change over time.
Data is provided in machine-readable format(s)
The machine-readable dataset is available as a whole

indicators.justification:
There are regularly events organized in Saudi Arabia by the government or civil society and supported by the Government to encourage open data reuse (1). Many events have been organized in the last years to support open data reuse with the support of civil society, especially the Saudi Data Community (2)(3).

1- https://data.gov.sa/en/getenvolved
2- https://www.datacommunitysa.com/home/

indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have an active open data initiative since 2015 managed by Yesser eGovernment program (1)(2). Since 2020, a new Open Data Interim regulations become in place (3) and NDMO (National Data Management Office in SDAIA) became the entity in charge of open data in KSA.

There is only Emirate of Riyad that are publishing open datasets on the national open data portal (1). Datasets include general statistics about the city's population, electronic services, classifications of their yearly work etc.

indicators.justification: The research did not find any  political integrity data interoperable across different political integrity datasets, as well as other datasets associated with relevant information flows in Saudi Arabia.

responses.response_text: The datasets do not share common identifiers.
responses.subquestion_text: There is evidence that datasets share common identifiers.
The key datasets for this theme share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The different political integrity datasets use common identifiers for public officials.
Lobbying data and political finance data share common identifiers for lobbyist clients and party and campaign donors.
Lobbying registers and public consultation data use common identifiers for regulations.
Asset declarations and political finance disclosures share common identifiers for interests, assets, and liabilities.
The various datasets share common identifiers for legal persons associated with donations, interests, assets, liabilities, and lobbying activities.
The key datasets for the political integrity and company information modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and land modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public finance modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public procurement modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.

indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have Companies Law (1) provides the basis for collecting and publishing beneficial ownership data on companies. The law state that ownership information should be collected and be publicly accessible except for partnership according to article 13 of the Law.

evidence.title: Data Management and Personal Data Protection Standards

responses.response_text: A framework exists but lacks full force of law.
responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
There are minimum standards for metadata when government data is catalogued or published.
There is a standardised process for publishing and updating published government data.
There are technical standards, including common data models, codelists, and identifiers for management and publication of government data.
There are clearly documented quality control processes for government data.
There are clearly documented processes for soliciting and integrating feedback from external users to improve data quality.

responses.response_text: The data management approaches assessed generally apply across the whole public sector.
responses.subquestion_text: How broadly is good data management practice established?

indicators.justification:
Basic law of Governance of Saudi Arabia n 90 of 1412 provides the legal text for public finance in the kingdom, Chapter seven Financial affairs (Article 72 to 78), in addition to the state revenue law n 68 of 1431.

The legal framework requires the creation of state budget and expenditures, but without any mention to structured data or a specific classification.

indicators.justification:
There is no political parties or national elections available in Saudi Arabia (1). Saudi Law of Municipal Councils first issued in 2014, in the article 51 the law forbid candidates from receiving any funding from third parties (2). The punishment could be an imprisonment for a period not exceeding one year or a fine not exceeding fifty thousand riyals, or with both penalties.

In the same article, it's mentioned that it's forbidden if the candidate does not disclose the sources of funding for his electoral campaign, and the ways in which it was spent. However there is no mention of funding details in the Executive Regulations for Municipal Councils System.

indicators.justification:
Saudi Arabia have a new Cabinet Resolution No. 476, dated 07/15/1441 (March 10th, 2020) related to the establishment of a rules and regulations support unit in the National Competitiveness Center. The purpose of this unit is to manage public consultation process in the country (1).

There are few consultations available online related to the finance sector, telecom, and few others (2)(3)(4).
